body.p: “The mantel-tree of a small fireplace in a chamber is an oak joist with the inside corner sloped off thus: [image 1] That of the great kitchen fireplace is a pine timber “,” ten inches by thirteen “,” also with a great sloped surface within “,” showing traces of fire. [image 2 inset]”
PE 9, pg. 517-518 / 3 Sept 1854 – 12 May 1855 / NNPM MA 1302:24 / T vol. # XVIII / PDF # XIII
